scriptLines.text: The forest trail is a lonely one, and you haven't seen anyone else for a day's time, when you come across two men on the trail's edge, peering through the underbrush at something conspiratorially.  You slow your pace and still your step as you approach them, making sure that they see you before you get too close.

The one with the stick notices you first, and waves you over with it, conspiratorially.  He's got one dead eye, and a queer smile, but he's got rough, work-worn hands - a laborer, not a throat-slitter.  You crouch-walk carefully towards them, and then the drunker of the two spots you, looking alarmed for a moment.
"Ey, ey... it's another one," he says, watching you bleary-eyed as you approach.  You don't know what he means, but he seems rather pleased with himself, and very, very inebriated.
"Oi, keep quiet.  Yer gonna interrupt 'em," his monocular compatriot replies in hushed tones, as you get close enough to reply in kind.
"Interrupt who?" you ask, and he fixes his one good eye on yours with a wry smile.
"Look for yerself," he says, crab-walking a pace to give you room to look through the same gap in the foliage.  You peer through, and your hand snaps to your mouth to stifle a surprised gasp.

Their whining moans are just barely audible from that distance, as the orc grunts and growls their own vocalizations, apparently unaware of their audience.

"I dunnae if that's how she thought her heroics would go, though.  I don't think she set out with the hopes that a fifteen stone orc'd use her wronghole as a cock-warmer."

You don't know the full truth of the situation, but you feel like someone should speak up.  It doesn't seem like your two cohorts have any plans to, nor would they have the sense or skill about them to do anything if a fight broke out.
